intro: Commelinidium gabunense, commonly known as the Gabon spiderwort, is a flowering plant native to Central and Southern Africa. It belongs to the family Commelinaceae, which includes grass-like plants and is characterized by its ability to thrive in moist, tropical environments. The plant features slender, erect stems and produces small, clustered flowers in shades of white and pink. Its leaves are typically narrow and grass-like, with a smooth surface and a prominent midrib. Commelinidium gabunense is often found in wetlands, marshes, and along riverbanks, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
